title: (x) 'T Cherry': script / A bit stuck with this font. - Gazelle {Mike Y}
content:
Hi, can anyone help identify this?  
I am a bit stuck.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202110513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/cherry_tmp_3863.jpg)
  
Thanks in advance.
author: Prodigal

comments.content:
That looks like one I know by the name of Ingrid, but I think that's an alias.

- Mike Yanega

Here is the sample from the Script Font ID Guide. It's also known as Ingenius and Chaucer.

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202110513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/'Ingrid'ms_6409.gif)
Unless they are due to scanning, the different shades of grey/black suggests this was done by hand with china ink. IMVHO, fkoors.

Hmm, now that I see them together, it looks like Ingrid is only similar. Upon further looking in the Script Guide, I think this is a Casaday & Greene font called Gazelle (a.k.a. Gaze). See the attached image, which is rather fuzzy quality. I can see why you may think it is hand-drawn, but don't you think those r's are awfully like each other, to the point of being identical?

- Mike Yanega

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202110513im_/http:/typophile.com/files/GazelleC_5982.gif)

Awesome. Gazelle it is. Thankyou very much.  
The odd black/grey shading was due to the fact it was a digi pic of a shop front that I pulled the text from.

Many thanks.

Lovely

_"but don’t you think those r’s are awfully like each other, to the point of being identical?"_

[evan](http://web.archive.org/web/20100202110513/http:/www.evanmade.com/)
